properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 15 at 1:49PM PST until January 16 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Upgraded from and Advisory to a Warning.

* WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph
expected.

* WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties.

* WHEN...From 10 AM to 7 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
Blowing dust could cause periods of low visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will increase by late morning with
the peak speeds expected Thursday afternoon. Winds will impact
the US-95 corridor in Mineral County with travel restrictions
possible. Increased potential for enhanced fire danger with
the strong winds and relatively dry conditions.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time Secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds
increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do
is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and
water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in
the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM PST THURSDAY
